general_advisory: Prevailing fog condition and gradual increase in temperature may increase the infestation for sucking pest like White fly, Aphids, Jassids & Thirps in vegetables. Regularly monitor the crop & install yellow sticky trap @ 8/acre. Spraying of pesticides to be done after 3 pm to protect the honey bee.

advisory: Transplanting of 25-30 days old seedlings should be done at a spacing of 20x15 cm, plant 2-3 seedlings per hill for high yielding varieties.
Farmers going for transplanting should apply 35 kg DAP, 20 kg MOP, and 8 kg Urea per acre during last puddling as basal fertilizer.

Foliar spraying of (Tebuconazole + Trifloxystrobin)@0.5ml/litre of water along with plantomycin@1g/litre of water 5-6 days before transplanting is recommended for disease management in nursery & main field.
Monitor the activity of white grub & install light trap to attract the beetles.
Localized application of Chloropyriphous dust is recommended to minimize white grub infestation in groundnut.
Need based spraying and drenching with (carbendazim + mancozeb) or (metaloxyl + mancozeb) @ 2gm/lit of water is recommended to protect the crop from collar rot, stem rot, and tikka disease.
For control of Flea beetle & other defoliators, spray Prophenophos@2ml/litre of water in the initial crop growth stage.
Rouging of MYMV & ULCV infected plants & spraying of Difenthurion 50WP@200g/acre or 1g/litre of water is recommended.

Prevailing fog condition and gradual increase in temperature may increase the infestation of aphid. Need based spraying of neem oil formulation @ 600ml per acre or Flonicamid @ 60g per acre is recommended.
Spraying of Emamectin benzoate @80gm per acre is recommended to reduce the infestation of cabbage weber and Spodoptera litura.
The weather is suitable for the application of fertilizer to rabi vegetables which are at 3 to 4 weeks stage.
To prevent wilting in brinjal and tomato apply Neem or Karanjaa cake and spray Tebuconazole fungicide @ 1ml/liter.
Install Yellow Sticky trap to trap the vector (Whitefly) of Papaya Leaf Curl Virus.
Alternate spraying of Neem oil formulation 1500ppm @3ml/lit of water and flonicamid 50WG @0.3g/litre is recommended to control whitefly.
Spray Marigold plant with Difenthurion @1g/li. Of water or Abamectin @0.75ml/li. Of water to control infestation of Thrips, Aphids, Mites, and Leaf Minor.

Animals should be given mineral mixture along with salt regularly and wheat grains, jaggery etc. may be provided @ 10%-20% in the daily ration during the winter season to meet the energy requirement of the animals.
